Caption: Sir C.V. Raman, escorted by Prof. Rayudu (NCC commander, Department of Mechanical Engineering), inspects the guard of honour
Description: The Chief Guest and speaker for IITâ€™S third convocation, which was held on the 30th of July, 1966 was none other than Dr. C. V. Raman, the Indian physicist and awardee of the Nobel Prize and Bharat Ratna for his ground breaking works in the area of light scattering. On the day of the event, upon reaching the campus, Dr. C. V. Raman was received by Prof. B. Sengupto, Director of the Institute, and Shri C.V. Sethunathan, Registrar. The Chief Guest was then presented a Guard of Honor by the cadets of the N.C.C. He was escorted by Prof. Rayudu (NCC commander, Department of Mechanical Engineering) to inspect the Guard.
